paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant I127V, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.phenotype: sensorimotor polyneuropathy with atypical transthoracic echocardiogram findings

individual_records.phenotype_details: progressive symmetric bilateral hand numbness and weakness, later bilateral symmetric lower extremity numbness and weakness
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 59-year-old male with no significant past medical history presented with progressive symmetric bilateral hand numbness and weakness.

functional_data.summary: The I127V mutation is associated with transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to misfolded protein aggregation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is present in the patient with symptoms consistent with hATTR.
variants.additional_notes: The case highlights the atypical presentation of the I127V variant.
key_quotes: This demonstrated the autosomal dominant heterozygous c.379 A> G p.I127V mutation in the TTR gene.
The rarity of our case is also seen in the upper extremity involvement preceding lower extremity involvement months later.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a single variant in the TTR gene.
